intro: Linociera brachythyrsa, commonly known as the narrow-thorned hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Linociera brachythyrsa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or coastal areas.
